Instruction: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (175 degrees Celsius). Grease a 9x5 inch loaf pan.

Cream butter and sugar in a medium bowl until smooth. Add eggs one at a time, then stir in sour cream. In another bowl, sift together flour, baking soda, cream of tartar, and salt; stir into the sour cream mixture. Fold in raisins. Transfer batter to the greased loaf pan.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Butter a 9x5-inch loaf pan. In a medium bowl, beat together the butter and sugar until smooth. Add the eggs one at a time, then mix in the sour cream. Stir in the flour, baking soda, cream of tartar, and salt until just combined. Fold in the raisins. Pour the batter into the prepared loaf pan.

Bake the bread for 50 to 60 minutes in the preheated oven, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
